content.p: Below are some Greasemonkey user scripts I wrote. Greasemonkey is an extension for Firefox which allows users to alter the content and behavior of any website through user scripts which work inside the browser.
To install a user script you first need Greasemonkey installed. After that, open the user script in Firefox and select 'Install User Script' from the 'Tools' menu.
For a large collection of other Greasemonkey user scripts, visit the Greasemonkey Wiki.

Tracking down and reading unread posts on Lambda the Ultimate started to annoy me quite a bit. Lambda Skipper adds a direct jump to the top-most unread post for each node to the Recent posts overview. It also adds links to skip to the next unread post in the node view (in top-to-bottom order rather than chronological order).

Nu Compact rewrites the four 'main' stories with pictures on the nu.nl frontpage to regular links. The images have nothing to do with the story anyway, and this allows us to have the entire frontpage in one screen.

TisNiks is a small collection of Javascript functions for querying the TisVU application of the Vrije Universiteit. As a proof-of-concept application of TisNiks, I created the BBTis user script that shows your latest grades on the VU Blackboard homepage.
